title: Papaya Personal (Employees, Workers & Contractors)
body:
Employees are the most valuable resource at any company. So we built a special corner of the platform just for you.Papaya Personal makes it easy to see your pay slips and manage your time off reports. It’s user-friendly and responsive on mobile devices.
Login to your Papaya Personal:
Download the Papaya Global App
Iphone AppAndroid AppLogin to the web portal 
 
 
WITH PAPAYA PERSONAL YOU CAN:
View and download pay slips instantly and track your payment historyReport time off and see all previous time off at a glance
 
HOW IT WORKS ?

title: Reporting Time Off (Employees, Workers & Contractors)
body:
In your Papaya Personal you can login to report time off easily, directly, and in real time. You can also review past entries. 
In addition, we will send you an email reminder at the start of every pay cycle asking you to report time off on Papaya Personal (Getting Ready for Payroll). Make sure to complete the reporting before the deadline to prevent delays in your payroll.To make a report:In the Papaya Personal dashboard click the button Report Leave and choose:
Type of leave - Choose the leave type (Vacation, Sick, Unpaid, Maternity, and other options)Time range - Select the specific dates you were out Upload any documents, if necessary, such as doctor's note, reserve duty certificates, etc. Use the comment area if you wish to elaborate further.
Click Submit and your report will be added on the screen. To make a change, simply hover over the line you wish to change and click the "pencil" icon to edit the report. If you want to see previous time off reports, flip through the calendar or click View All to see past entries and those you posted in advance. Most importantly, make the most of your time off to recharge and come back stronger than ever. :)

title: Files Tab (HR & Finance Teams)
body: The Files tab contains all the documents related to each payment cycle and project. Documents include time-off reports, commissions reports, team members onboarding packets, payroll data, payroll summary, payments, banking, payslip files, and more. The filters allow you to view any pay cycle, including the current cycle, and to choose the pay step, type, and category you want. You can also use the search bar to look for specific keywords.In addition, the tab allows you to upload files relevant to the current or future pay cycles. Our local in-country partners also have access to this tab and will review and upload documents applicable to them.

title: How to Add/Remove/Update Users & Permissions on my Company Account
body:
To manage users and permissions on your account:
Log in to the Papaya Platform Click on the Help Center icon in the top navigation bar and then choose Contact Us -> Papaya Users, choose the relevant action to open the request, fill the required fields and Submit.You will receive an email once your request is completed.Use the Platform User Permissions list to decide what role you want to give to the user.

title: How to Import a Worker's Absence Report to the Papaya Platform
body:
During a worker’s time at the company, EoR employers (In-county partners) are obligated to maintain the balance and accrual of the worker's absences and leaves.  
 
Therefore, reporting is a critical and integral part of the monthly cycle. Ottherwise the balance and accrual will not reflect the worker's true status and could lead to mistakes and potential loss of worker’s rights.
 
Papaya enables its workers and clients to report PTO through the platform in three different ways: 
 
Worker Report of PTO through Papaya Personal. Click here  for guidance.Company Admin/Finance Manager report on-behalf of the worker. Click here  for guidance.Import PTO Report from HRIS.
The goal of this help article is to guide you through the steps required to import a report file from your HRIS platform into the Papaya Platform.
Configuration Steps:
Contact your Customer Success Manager and update him/her that you wish to enable the Import Capability for you accountsYou will be asked to share the following information with Papaya to enable the import capability:
List of all PTO types in your HRIS/Platform Report Example from your HRIS or Dedicated platformWorkers Unique Identifier (Worker external ID or Email address set for the worker in the Papaya Platform)
3.  Papaya's technical team will process the information and create the configuration that enables the PTO import capability. 
 
Once everything is set, you will be notified that the import capability is operational.
Importing PTO report steps:
Login to the Papaya PlatformNavigate to Project>Payroll>Salary UpdatesClick the three dots button on the right Choose Import XLSIn the dropdown list, scroll down and choose "Workers PTO" and click UploadChoose the PTO report file to uploadIn the dialog box that will be displayed - Confirm: Project Name, File Name, Import Type (PTO), Pay Period to apply and check the box below.Click Import
Important Notes:
Only past PTO date range will be applied to the chosen cycleFuture PTO's will be applied to future cyclesIf the PTO applies to a specific cycle but the cutoff date (Salary Updates Publish Day) already occurred, the PTO record will apply to the following cycle.

title: Invoice Management
body:
The Invoice Page
The Invoice page supports the following functionalities:
 
Viewing invoices in all projects to which you have access Adding and viewing invoice Proof of PaymentDownloading an Excel file containing the data for one or more invoice/sExporting one or more invoice/s file/sInitiating an Invoice Dispute and tracking dispute status
 
Invoices are added to the Invoices page once they are Published in the Papaya platform.
Accessing Invoice Management Page
To access the Invoice Management page, open the Organization menu in the Papaya main dashboard, and click Company > Invoices. 
If any unpaid invoices are pending in your projects, a notification will open in the main Dashboard page. Clicking on the > icon in the notification will open the Invoice page:
 
 
Page Structure
The invoice page has three (3) tabs, displaying invoices that are Unpaid, in Dispute, and Paid:
 
 
Most columns are identical across all tabs, but some are unique to a specific tab:
ColumnDetailsTab/sInvoice NumberInvoice Papaya ID
- Unpaid
 - In Dispute
 - Paid
ProjectProject for which invoice was issued
- Unpaid
- In Dispute
- Paid
Billing EntityLegal entity to which invoice was issued.
- Unpaid
- In Dispute
- Paid
AmountInvoice amount, in the currency the invoice was issued
- Unpaid
- In Dispute
- Paid
TypeInvoice type -Standard/Deposit/ Credit
- Unpaid
- In Dispute
- Paid
Issue DateDate on which invoice was issued in the Papaya platform
- Unpaid
- In Dispute
- Paid
Due DateDate on which invoice payment is due
- Unpaid
- In Dispute
- Paid
UrgentWhen due date is 7 days or less from publication date OR when due date has passed, invoice will be marked "Urgent".UnpaidProof of PaymentProof of Payment indication
 
- Unpaid
- In Dispute
- Paid
StatusStatus of invoice dispute process.In Dispute
 
Context Menu/s
Each invoice record in all 3 tabs has a context menu. The menu options are determined by the tab:
TabContext Menu OptionsUnpaid
View Details - view invoice details
Download - download single invoice 
Dispute - initiate dispute process for invoice
Add Proof of Payment - upload PoP (enabled if invoice has no PoP)
View Proof of Payment - view PoP (enabled if invoice has PoP)
In Dispute
View Details - view invoice details
Download - download single invoice 
Dispute Details - view dispute details
Paid
View Details - view invoice details
Download - download single invoice 
Dispute Invoice - initiate dispute process for invoice
 
Viewing Invoices
Sorting Invoices
The default display of the Invoices table is by Due Date descending order. Click Type, Issue Date, or Due Date to sort by column value ascending/descending order:
 
Filtering Invoices
Click on any of the filter buttons to select invoice parameters for display:Projects- display invoices issued for selected project/sBilling Entity - display invoices issued to selected legal entity/iesCurrency - display invoices issued in selected currency/iesType - display invoices of selected type (Standard/Deposit/Credit)Period- display invoices issues within a selected date range
The default number of invoices displayed in table is 10. Use pagination dialog to change displayed number per page:
Invoice Preview
To preview an invoice, click the invoice number link in the Invoice Number column: 
 
Invoice Details
To view invoice details:
Open context menu next to the relevant invoiceClick View Details to open the invoice in the Project module:
Adding/Viewing Proof of Payment
Proof of Payment can be uploaded for invoices in the Unpaid tab only.
Upload PoP for a Single Invoice
To add Proof of Payment to an invoice:
Open Unpaid tab, then open the context menu next to the relevant invoiceSelect Add Proof of PaymentIn the Proof of Payment dialog, enter Invoice Amount and payment Transfer Date Upload proof of payment documentClick Submit
 
Upload PoP for Multiple Invoices
To add a single Proof of Payment to multiple invoices:
Open Unpaid tab, then check the boxes next to relevant invoiceSelect Add Proof of PaymentIn the Proof of Payment dialog, enter Invoice Amount and payment Transfer Date Upload proof of payment documentClick Submit
 
 
 
To view Proof of Payment attachment:
Make sure the invoice has a Proof of Payment iconOpen context menu and select View Proof of Payment
Viewing PoP
To view Proof of Payment attachment:
Make sure the invoice has a Proof of Payment iconOpen context menu and select View Proof of Payment
Downloading Invoice/s
The download feature enables you to download the invoice file for one or more invoice/s.
 
Downloading a Single Invoice
To download a single invoice, open the context menu next to the relevant invoice and click Download:
Downloading Multiple Invoices
To download multiple invoices, check the boxes next to the invoices you wish to download, then click the Download button at the top of the table:
Exporting Invoice/s
This feature enables you to export an Excel file containing the data for selected invoice/s.
 
Exporting One or More Invoice/s
To export data for one or more invoice/s, check the boxes next to the invoice/s you wish to export, then click the Export button that will appear at the top of the table:
Exporting All Invoices
To export data for all invoice/s, click the Export All Data button:
 
Invoice Dispute Process
Only users with the following roles can view and use this feature: HR Manager, Finance Manager, Billing Contact. If you have the relevant role and cannot access this feature, contact your CSM.
This features allows you to dispute an invoice with Papaya for a number of reasons: wrong amount, wrong Billing Entity, etc. An invoice can be disputed regardless of 
Disputing an Invoice
invoices can be disputed via the invoices table or the preview function:
To dispute an invoice via the invoices table:
Identify relevant invoice in invoices tableOpen context menu next to the relevant invoiceClick Dispute InvoiceProceed to populate dispute dialog
 
To dispute an invoice via the preview function:
Preview the relevant invoiceClick Dispute InvoiceProceed to populate dispute dialog
Invoice Dispute Dialog
Following initiating of a single/multiple invoice dispute, the dispute dialog will open:
Review list of invoice/s in disputeSelect reason for dispute. Selecting at least one reason is mandatory.Add comments. If you selected Other as the dispute reason - this field is mandatoryIf you wish Papaya to contact you regarding the dispute, check Contact me for DetailsClick Submit
 
Dispute Management Process
The dispute process will be managed by the Papaya team following submission of dispute. 
 
Once you initiate a dispute, you will receive a confirmation email:
 
Viewing Dispute Status/Details
Invoices in dispute are displayed in the In Dispute tab, which has a dispute indication in the Status column. You can hover over the indicator to view the dispute workflow:
 
 
To view dispute details, open the context menu next to the relevant invoice in the In Dispute tab, and select Dispute Details:

title: Journal Entry Automation
body:
Papaya Global automatically translates your payroll data and creates a JE file that can be uploaded into any ERP system. 
Payroll JEs will be created from the information on the Papaya Global platform and the Payroll Summary. 
EOR JEs will be created from the information on the Papaya Global platform and the EOR invoice.  
 
Onboarding: 
For the one time mapping you must provide Papaya Global’s JE team with the following files. 
Send the files to your account manager and cc teamjournalentries@papayaglobal.com.
Please note: any email relating a JE issue or request must also be sent to teamjournalentries@papayaglobal.com.
JE sample 
The JE sample must include all the fields in your JE with an explanation of what data goes into which column.  
GL mapping  
This step can only happen after you have your Payroll Summary.  
A list of fields from the Payroll Summary will be sent to you, in this list you must provide the name of the fields in your ERP system. 
 
 
 
Once the names are sent, the Papaya JE team will map the fields and the process will be completed. From this point your JE file will be automatically created in each pay-cycle once you approve your Payroll Summary or receive your EOR invoice. 
Please note: As a best practice, we recommend diligently mapping general ledger accounts in the initial stages based on liabilities that will impact your bank. This will ensure that your journals accurately reflect net payments to workers and third-party payments to authorities. 
Ongoing: 
After the Payroll Summary is approved, the JE will be available within 2 hours. If there is any missing information (e.g., GL code for a new item), the JE team will reach out to you within 2 business days for the missing information. 
Once your JE is created you will receive an email notification with a link to the Papaya Global platform, the JE file will be in the Journal Entry folder in the Payment Summary section. Download your JE file and upload it to your ERP system.  
 
For mapping changes (edits, new fields or removing fields) email Papaya Global’s JE team at teamjournalentries@papayaglobal.com.
 
 
 
FAQs   
How is the JE file created? 
The approved payroll summary along with the GL mapping provided by your finance team are converted into your customized journal entry file. 
 
How do I know the nature of the pay item on the Payroll Summary? 
The payroll summary is approved by the HR department so this can be checked internally, or you can reach out to the Global Payroll Expert to help with explanation of pay items. 
 
When will the JE be available? 
Once the Payroll Summary is approved, the Journals will be triggered automatically and be available within 2 hours.  
In case there is a new item for GL mapping or a cost center missing, someone from the JE team will reach out to you for the missing information within 2 business days.

title: Non-monthly payroll Choosing the correct pay period for Salary Updates
body:
This article is only relevant for EOR workersFor bi-weekly projects, you will receive a dedicated payroll schedule detailing the cut-off date schedule per cycle per country.Unlike projects with a monthly payroll setup, for non-monthly payroll (semi-monthly, bi-weekly, and weekly), the  salary updates submission workflow requires more attention.. As both monthly and non-monthly projects have a single monthly cut-off date, it is required from finance managers to submit all salary updates, such as commission, expense reimbursement and bonuses, to the last pay period of the month, which is when the worker will be paid out for them.This means that you will need to choose in the drop down menu, the last pay period of that month (even if it spills over into the following month), and update the relevant figures for the workers and then click ‘Update Completed.’See below visualization of how to choose the last pay cycle for a April 2021 (Weekly project)FAQ:What are the salary update components that should be reported only in the Last cycle?Expenses, commissions, bonuses etc. Practically anything that is not fixed/basic pay components, such as salary or monthly allowances. How do I know what is the last payroll period of a specific month? The decision logic is -  the last pay period in specific month is when Its end date, which must be still part of that month - is either the last day of that month or the closest to the last day of that month.  Note: If the start date of a pay period takes place in specific month and the end date takes place in the consecutive month, the pay period would be considered as the first pay period of the consecutive month  (e.g. August 26th - September 1st ==> Is the first pay period of September). Examples for April 2021 & May 2021- The last pay period cycle is bolded: Weekly Payroll (Project A) - April 2021 Pay Periods: 
    {March 29th – April 4th} {April 5th – April 11th} {April 12th – April 18th} {April 19th – April 25th}  Weekly Payroll (Project A) - May 2021 Pay Periods:
    {April 26th – May 2nd} {May 3rd – May 9th}{May 10th – May 16th}{May 17th – May 23rd}{May 24th – May 30th}  Bi-Weekly Payroll (Project B) – April 2021 Pay Periods: 
    March 29th – April 11th} {April 12th – April 25th}  Bi-Weekly Payroll (Project C) – April 2021 Pay Periods:
    {March 22th – April 4th}{April 5th – April 18th}  Bi-Weekly Payroll (Project C) – May  2021 Pay Periods:
    {April 19th – May 2nd}, {May 3rd – May 16th}{May 17th – May 30th}

title: Payments: Payment Approval Flow
body:
What is the Payment Approval Flow:
The payments approval flow is an automated workflow that defines the approval process for each payment. It will be triggered every time a new payment is created and pending approval.
 
How the Payment Approval Flow Works:
The payments approval flow includes one step. Approvers receive an automatic notification when the payments are ready to review and approve, in which they'll have the ability to approve or decline each payment from the Papaya Payment management screen. 
 
Any user with the role of, Payments Manager, has the ability to approve payments.
 
How to Deactivate:
It is possible to skip the payment approval step by deactivating this approval chain for the project. In this case, payments will be generated and sent for execution based on the approved Payroll Summary Report, without requiring additional approval.
To deactivate a Payments approval chain, select the Payments approval chain and click the active/inactive toggle to confirm that the approval chain should be deactivated. Do this for every project you wish to deactivate the payment approval flow for.
Click here to learn about configuring Payroll Summery approval chainsClick here  to learn about configuring invoice approval chains

title: Payroll Wizard: Creating a Payroll Worker
body:
What is the Payroll Wizard?
The Payroll Wizard enables you to create a Payroll-type worker in an existing project.
The following users can create a new Payroll worker via the wizard: Customer HR Manager, and Customer Finance Manager.
To request a new EOR Worker - see EOR Wizard .
Launching the Payroll Worker Wizard
To create a new Payroll Worker via the Payroll Wizard, take the following steps:
Log in to the Papaya PlatformClick on People>Add Worker go to the Payroll Worker tile, and click Add New Worker:The New Payroll Worker wizard will open:
Working with the Wizard
At any point in the configuration process, you can click the following:
Back - return to previous stepCancel - abort process and return to Add Worker pageNext - proceed to next step; actionable only after current step mandatory fields are populated.
Wizard Steps
 
StepActionsProject
1. Select the Country in which the new worker's project is located. 
2.  Click on Project to which the new worker will be assigned
3.  Click Next
 
To assign the new worker to a new project in an existing country or a new project in a new country, please contact your CSM.
Worker Details
1.  Enter worker details (note mandatory fields) and bank details
2.  For Expat workers:  indicate if worker has work permit, and if so - upload permit document3.  Click Next
Employment Information
1.  Enter Contract Information (note mandatory field)
2.  Enter Organizational Attributes
3.  Enter Worker Address
4.  Click Next
Compensation
1.  Enter Contract Compensation details (note mandatory fields)
2.  Enter Contract Terms (note mandatory fields)
3.  Click Next
Documents
1.  Upload relevant documents (note mandatory document)
2.  Upload hidden documents that will not be sent to payroll processing or displayed to the worker
3.  Click Review
Review
1.  Review the information for accuracy. Click section edit icon to revise information.
2.  Check the mandatory consent clause checkbox
3.  Use radio buttons to indicate when Papaya should contact the worker for onboarding.
4.  Click Submit.
New Worker Confirmation
The submission confirmation dialog will enable you to: 
Initiate a new request process in the same project as the submitted request Initiate a new request process in a different project Open the new worker's worker profile page:

title: Payroll: Company Salary Updates
body:
The Papaya platform gives you different options to update your pay-cycle information, this page will explain how you can update one-time variables (such as, commission, expenses etc.) for multiple projects at once. 
Company Salary Updates (Export/Import)
1.  Navigate to Payroll in the main menu. 
 
2. Click "Company Salary Updates" 
 
3. Select all the projects that you wish to update in this current cycle. You can choose all projects or specific projects. 
Remember, updates can be submitted until each project's cut-off date. 
 
4. Click "Export" - A template file with the relevant projects will be downloaded to your device for review and editing. 
Please note: If you selected projects with different pay frequencies, a separate template will be downloaded for each pay frequency. 
 
5. Open the file and update one-time variables for any worker within the included projects. 
Tips for updating:
All items should be input in the local payment currency per project. Add any free text comments in the Comment column. Remember that any change you input will only be applied for the current cycle. Permanent salary changes cannot be updates via this method. Don't forget to save after completing all your changes. 
6. To import your changes, click Import  and select the relevant file.
7. The system will present a summary of the projects about to be updated for your review. Click Import to complete the update. 
Please note: If your file includes projects that have already been published, they will be indicated in the review screen. You can still complete the import, and those projects will be automatically skipped. 
 
 
Final validation:
You can export a file again to confirm that you are satisfied with the final payroll inputs. 
 
*Prefer to review all your projects in one shot? Don't remember what you logged already and want a quick verification? Go to our BI report Salary Updates Overview.

title: Payroll: Independent Contractor (SOW) payment request review & Approval (HR & Finance Teams)
body: Papaya offers two types of Payment Request submissions. The process centralizes communications and consolidates all paperwork into one place.Independent Contractors - SOW Contract ProjectsYour independent contractors need final updates in order to prepare payment requests and upload their invoices for the current pay cycle. A few days before the pay period's cut-off date, a notification will be sent to thel contractors to log in to the platform, formulate the payment request, and upload invoices and other supporting documents.Pro-Forma Creation and Submission: Each contractor will be able log in to the platform to submit their payment request and tax invoice and other supporting documents.Pro-Forma Audit & Approval: From the 'Payment Summary' tab the Finance Manager will be able to review submission status, audit pro-forma vs. submitted invoice and reject or approve payment request.Payroll Summary Report: Once all payment request approved Payroll Summary generation would be initiated, once it is ready it should approved by Finance Manager before payment execution.  Contractor Payment Execution: Once the payment summary is approved by the client's Finance Manager, Papaya will initiate the payment process according to project settings.

title: Payroll: Parallel Runs
body: What is a Parallel Run? A Parallel Run (or parallel test) is a feature that enables all participants involved in the payroll process to rehearse and align on their portions of the new payroll process before going live. More specifically, performing a Parallel Run allows you to process payroll on two systems (in parallel) - your legacy system and the Papaya Platform system. The Benefit of Parallel Runs: Parallel Runs provide you with the opportunity to compare outputs, understand, and fix any payroll discrepancies before officially going live with the Papaya Platform system. A Parallel Run Consists of: Preparing the environment on the new system - loading data, configuring accounting codes, and configuring integrations Completing the Salary Updates Running the payroll Comparing the output and managing discrepancies (repeating previous steps as necessary) Approving that the final payroll is correct A parallel run may also include test payments (penny tests)  Parallel tests usually run for 1-3 pay cycles, allowing for corrections before the go-live date is finalized and payroll is fully transferred to the Papaya Platform.  Identifying Parallel Runs on the Papaya Platform: The Papaya Platform will indicate that a pay cycle is a Parallel Run to ensure all participants in the payroll process are aware that the cycle is a Parallel Run and not a live cycle. The indication will appear in the following areas of the Papaya Platform: Project dashboard - while the Parallel Run cycle is ongoing Payroll tab side-menu - while the Parallel Run cycle is ongoing Payroll tab steps - marking each relevant cycle Upload file flow BI Reports (Coming Q4 2021) Note: During Parallel Runs cycles, PTO notifications will not be sent out to workers. How to Configure a Parallel Run on the Papaya Platform: A project's onboarding CSM is responsible for configuring the Parallel Run. Please reach out to your CSM to configure a parallel run.

title: Payroll: Payroll Overview (HR & Finance Teams)
body:
Payroll provides you the status of your projects for the payroll period you select. Drill down to see action items at each step:  
Reporting - Your employees can report paid leave easily and the expenses will be consolidatedSalary Updates - Submit updates to your employees’ salary (commissions, bonuses, expenses, etc.) and upload salary reports and supporting documentsPayroll Summary - Review the final summary of the monthly payrollPayment: Monitor progress of the payslips delivered to the team members

title: Payroll: Payroll Summary (HR & Finance Teams)
body:
After salary updates has been published, data is processed by our in-country partners on their local systems. Once prepared, it is uploaded to Papaya's Platform and data is automatically audited and integrated into the Platform. When this process is completed, you receive a full report of the pay cycle to review and approve.    The report is generated in the standardized format designed by Papaya to meet all your needs quickly and consistently across all the locations you manage with us. The payroll report will include team members' cost plans, salary updates you provided in the previous step, and all relevant cost items to be included as part of the local payroll regulations by our in-country partner. To see the previous step, click here .Click Download to receive our standardized Excel with the three-sheet essentials: 
Employment Cost Breakdown - A gross to net breakdown based on the cost items from all the different categories compiling your payroll cycle: basic pay, variables, net additions and deductions, worker deductions, employer tax, liabilities and more. This data is also available for analysis on our BI report Payroll Costs BreakdownCost Comparison Breakdown - a month-over-month comparison per person, per cost item to easily spot substantial differences. This data is also available for analysis on our BI report Cost ComparisonNet Payments list - for easy execution of payments 
Click Review & Approve to follow the workflow configured for your organization.

title: Payroll: Salary Updates Activity Log (Finance & HR Teams)
body: Salary Updates is the crucial step in the payroll process. It's so central, in fact, that more than one member of your team might be adding updates directly to the Papaya Platform at the same time (see how here ).That means some reports will be hard to spot in real time. To ensure that when it’s time to publish, the Salary Updates is signed, sealed, and delivered, we added the Activity Log to review any and all changes to salaries. When you come to confirm, you have all the information you need to set the cycle free.  Simply go to the desired project Salary Updates step and click the 3 dots on the bottom table right corner which will open the log for review.

title: Payroll: Salary Updates Future Cycles (HR & Finance Teams)
body:
Salary updates are usually done for the coming cycle. Sometimes, you already know items you would like to add to future cycles. like an expected retention bonus, cash advance for expenses, or something similar. They may be unique situations, but that makes them all the more important to remember!You don't need to wait for the relevant cycle to come up in order to update. You can log it now for the a future cycle and not worry about remembering later.1. click Payroll > choose project > Salary updates tab2. Click the dropdown menu 'Cycle' and switch to the desired future cycle.Continue as usual and log your updates quickly directly on the platform or by Excel if you prefer and that's it. You are done, and you are prepared for the due date on this cost item. 
For non-monthly payroll: Check this article for further guidance how to select the correct pay period for the updates.

title: Payroll: Time Off Reporting Step (HR & Finance Teams)
body:
Time off is a sensitive cost item for any company, and even more so when dealing with a remote workforce.  
The Papaya Platform includes a built-in module to simplify time off reporting. 
Once you activate the feature, your teams receive periodic notifications and access through their personal portal to log their time off.  
 
You can see how it looks from your workers' perspective here . 
 
The Reporting step contains all the information you collect from your team members regarding time off for the pay cycle and allows you to: 
See what your people reported to dateReview supporting filesReport on Behalf of team members who sent it to you directly (yes, it was sent in email-old habits die hard) 
 
Visit our Time Off Dashboard in the BI suite to see essential metrics like Worker Taken Days / Total Taken Sick Days / Total Taken Days etc. Stay on top of all matters related to time off for your entire team.
 
If your worker did not report their time off, you can easily report it for them on the platform:
Click the Payroll Tab in the main menu, then choose the relevant project.
In the "Reports" page click "Report for Worker" 
Fill in all the information in the popup window and click "Save"
Once you filled in and saved to form you will see the information in the "Reported Time Off" section at the bottom of the "Report" page

title: Project: Proposals Tab (HR & Finance Teams)
body:
Each project has a dedicated tab consolidating all the information from your Papaya service agreement for easy access and full transparency. You can browse the Basic Fees, Prices for out of scope services and Terms and Conditions on the web page or download the full agreement by clicking on the paperclip icon on the left side of the page.  
\

title: Projects Tab (HR & Finance Teams)
body: The main dashboard provides a high-level overview of every active, closed, and future project, showing the number of active workers, types of service, and a link to our Countrypedia - Papaya's open-source guide to country's payroll and benchmarks.you can switch the display of dashboard from tiles to list by clicking on the icon in the right corner for more focused view.

title: Salary Update - Differences Tab
body:
Overview
The Salary Update report's Differences tab helps you manage Salary Update information and easily identify changes between pay cycles
 
This tab compares current vs pervious pay cycle data in 3 tables:
TableDataPay ItemsChanges to contract termsWorker CommentsWorker comments entered between pervious and current cycleHR ItemsHR information changes
Viewing the Differences Tab
To view the Salary Update report and Differences tab:
Access the Papaya DashboardClick on Payroll choose a project, click Salary Updates --> Download CSV
the Salary Update CSV file will download to your local machine. Open the file and click the Differences tab to view all the change tables:
Tab Tables
Pay Items
Each pay item change is displayed in a unique row: i.e. a worker who has 3 pay item changes between last & current pay cycles will have 3 rows.

title: Team Member: Card Overview (HR & Finance Teams)
body:
The Team Member Card contains all of the relevant information about each person on your payroll. Switch between the different "folder tabs" to navigate.Personal - Employee's personal information, contact and emergency contact details.
Employment - Contract, health plan and PTO information.
Costs - monthly breakdown of all employment cost items. The view provides a monthly and yearly simulation of costs. 
Payslips - all pay slips and payment history are located in this tab. It is also available to team members through their personal portal. 
Files - All personal documents for each worker: employment contract, tax forms, health declarations, copy of IDs and other relevant worker documents provided during onboarding, and ongoing updates.

title: Team Member: Cost Plan Tab (HR & Finance Teams)
body: The Cost Plan tab inside of the Team Member Card enables you to view both current and annual employment costs for each of your team members. This tab shows your annual gross costs for your workforce and a breakdown of the expected employer costs for your employment at the designated country.   The tab allows you to see costs in the local currency or your billing currency (USD/EUR). Currency Exchange rates are per the same day and might vary during the year. The amounts displayed are a cost simulations only.

title: Team Member: Payslips Tab (HR & Finance Teams)
body: The Payments tab on the Team Member Card  provides a view of each person's monthly payslips.To download all of the documents for a specific pay period, simply click Download All and you will get a zip file of all the relevant docs. You can also click on the three dot menu on the right to download a specific payslip.

title: Upload Supporting Documents - Onboarding and Salary updates (HR & Finance Teams)
body:
During the onboarding and also during the Salary updates you may need to include supporting materials.
These can be specific personnel documents like salary raise letters, doctors notes, health insurance documents, new bank details, etc. or company-related documents such as new pension policy, registration update documents, etc.To upload the files go the the Payroll tab on the main menu on the left, choose the relevant project and click the Salary Updates tab. 
Please note: The ICP can view all the files, but when you upload a file to the Workers folder the ICP will be notified. 
In the Salary Updates tab there are 2 ways to upload the file:
1. Click the Upload Files button in the Related files section, upload the file and choose the folder where you want the file to be uploaded. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
2. Click the folder you want the file to be uploaded to, in the folder click the Upload button and upload the file.

title: Welcome to the New Papaya Global Look
body:
We're excited to introduce you to the revamped version of Papaya Global! To ensure a seamless transition, we've prepared a quick guide highlighting the key changes between the old and new UI.
Don't see the new UI yet? Don't worry! It's on its way to you, starting January 2024. 
Quick Guide to the New UI: What to Expect
1. Streamlined Navigation:
The main navigation has been refined for a more intuitive user experience. Explore how the new layout can enhance your workflow.
2. Updated Look and Feel:
Experience a refreshed visual design aimed at making your interactions with Papaya Global more engaging and user-friendly.
3. Relocated Items:
Discover where certain features and buttons have been moved to optimize accessibility and efficiency.
Where to Find What: Quick Reference
Main Menu | Individual Salary Updates | Import Salary Updates | Import Time Off | Report Time Off on Behalf | Review and Approve Payroll | View/Upload Payroll Files | View/Upload Company Files | Add Worker | View Invoices | View Analytics (BI)
.
 
 
 
1. Main Menu:
Location: on the left of the screen. 
 
We’ve consolidated all of our menu items, previously located in different areas, into a single main menu that is now located on the left of the screen.
 
.
 
 
 
2. Input Salary Updates – Per Worker:
Location: Payroll (left menu) > Select Project > Salary Updates
 
Navigate to the Salary Updates and click on a worker to input changes for them individually. In the card that opens on the righthand side, input updates for compensation and variables.
 .
 
 
3. Input Salary Updates – Bulk Import:
Location: Payroll (left menu) > Select Project > Salary Updates > Import
We’ve shortened the process of making salary updates for multiple workers at once – simply navigate to the Salary Updates page for your project, and look for the export/import buttons on top of the worker list. Export the file to see the current raw data, make updates to the Excel file, and import the file back to save your changes.
 
.
 
 
 
4. Import Time Off:
Location: Payroll (left menu) > Company > Time Off Updates
Import time off in bulk for workers in multiple projects at once, using a source file in your own format. We changed the location of the time off import wizard to make it easier to access.  
.
 
 
 
5. Report Time Off on Behalf of a Worker
Location: Payroll (left menu) > Select Project > Reports > Report on Behalf
View time off reports if they were imported/reported by workers, or report time off on behalf of workers one by one via the Payroll Reports tab.
.
 
 
 
6. Review and Approve Payroll 
Location: Payroll > Select Project > Payroll Summary > View Approval Page
Anyone with access to the payroll can view the Payroll Summary and the approval chain log. Anyone who participates in the approval process can click the approval step related to them, and approve or add questions/comments via the card that opens on the right. 
.
 
 
 
7. View/Upload Payroll Files
Location: Click on the Files shortcut from Projects list, or click on a file category from within the payroll tab.
We’ve consolidated all payroll files to a single file management interface, and what were previously folders are now called categories. You can access the payroll files repository via a number of areas in the platform: from the main project list (view files per project), or from any of the files linked in the different steps of the payroll. To view all files or make a comprehensive search of all files, simply navigate to the list and remove the project, cycle or category filters.
 
.
 
 
 
8. View/Upload Company Files
 
New UI Location: Company > Files
All company-level settings have a new consolidated home, under the Company area.
.
 
 
 
9. Add Worker
Location: People > Add Worker, or Projects > Add Worker
Add new workers one by one directly via the People tab, or via the shortcut from the Projects List. 
.
 
 
 
10. View Invoices and Manage Billing
New UI Location: Company > Billing
All company-level settings have a new consolidated home, under the Company area.
.
 
 
 
11. View Analytics (BI Reports)
Location: Analytics (left menu)
All BI reports are available under the Analytics section, directly from the main menu.
 
Providing Feedback
Your feedback is invaluable to us! If you encounter any challenges, have suggestions, or notice any bugs, please don't hesitate to reach out. You can share your thoughts by filling out our feedback form.

title: Work Permit dashboard
body:
Papaya Global helps you keep track of your workers' permits. You can view all your workers' permits expiration dates and relevant actions on the Papaya Global platform. On the "Work Permit & Visas" page, you will find a comprehensive dashboard that shows the essential information about your EOR workers' work permits, such as the worker’s name, project, expiration date, time left (the remaining time until the permit's expiration), and status.  
Worker permit expiration: 
Four months before one (or more) of your workers’ work permits expire, a notification will be sent to you by Papaya Global.
To view the status of your EOR workers' work permits or to initiate the work permit renewal process, click on the “Open Immigration Page” link.  
By clicking this link, you will be directed to the Visas & Permits page within Papaya platform.  
Important: Clicking this link will not trigger any immediate actions. It is designed to provide access to your employee work permit status dashboard.  
To access specific details and take necessary actions, follow these steps: 
Click on an individual worker to open their dedicated information section. You can access additional details about their work permit within the worker's section. 
Actions Available:  
Initiate Work Permit Renewal: 
By clicking the "Request Renewal" button, the system will alert your CSMs that a work permit renewal is needed.  
The worker's status will change to "In Renewal" to indicate that the renewal process is initiated. 
Important: This action will not incur any automatic charges. It's simply a way to notify our team you are interested in initiating the renewal process. 
Request Contract Termination: 
Clicking the "Request Contract Termination" button will initiate the process for contract termination. The worker's status will change to "In Termination" to indicate that the termination process has been requested. 
Important: This is the first step to initiate the termination process. Remember to follow Papaya’s guidelines on EOR terminations , and not to reach out to the worker independently under any circumstances regarding terminations. 
Request CSM Support: 
If you require additional assistance or have specific work permit questions, click the "Request CSM Support" button. Our Customer Success Managers are here to provide guidance and support.  
The worker's status will change to "In CSM Support" to indicate that assistance is requested.

title: Worker Cost Overview Tab
body:
Overview
The Worker Cost Overview tab provides users with an overview of the worker overall cost by Pay Cycle, Year To Date, and Annually. 
 
The tab also provides a detailed breakdown of each employee’s employer cost, allowing Finance and Top Manager Users to analyze worker cost elements by category (such as Basic Pay, Contributions, taxes, etc.), and track these elements over time.
 
Data Sources
The Worker Cost Overview tab presents both actual data and expected data. 
 
The actual data reflects actual employer costs as in the Payroll Summary (Gross-2-Net) data that was received from the ICP, and the expected data reflects prospective future employer costs.
WorkerActual Data SourceExpected Data SourceEORActual data received from ICPs (Payroll Summary / Invoices) Salary simulation (by ICP/Papaya) to employee onboarding + contract.PayrollActual salary data received from ICPs (Payroll Summary) Base compensation data based on employee contract information.
 
Worker Cost Overview Tab Functions
Page Structure
The page has three main sections: Header, Overview, & Breakdown. 
 
Data in the Header section is linked to the Overview and Breakdown sections: filters applied in the Header modify data display in the Overview & Breakdown sections.
 
Header Section
Section Structure
 
#ComponentData/Function1Last UpdateMost recent cost cycle on which actual data was entered into the system.2Year SelectionDetermines the year for which data is displayed. Currently displayed year is indicated by a red line.3Cycle Cost
3.1  Recent cycle cost (actual data)
3.2  Worker payment currecy
3.3  Data date range 
4YTD Cost
4.1  Total employer costs to date (actual data)
4.2  Worker payment currency
4.3  Data date range
5Annual Cost
5.1  Annual employee cost (actual + expected data)
5.2  Worker payment currency
5.3  Data date range
Changing Year Selection
To select a different year to display and analyse:
Click on year tab in Header sectionAll page sections will update to display data for the selected year.
Overview Section
Section Structure
 
#ComponentData/Function1HeaderYear for which data is displayed, as selected in Header.2IntervalSelect Monthly/Quarterly interval for graph data. 3Data Type
Actual - actual employer costs
Expected - expected employer costs
4GraphEmployer cost over selected year, by interval5TotalTotal expenses for month/quarter (on hover)6SubtotalCategory expenses subtotal for month/quarter (on hover)7CategoriesCategories of specific worker’s cost elements.
Changing Graph Display
You can manage graph data display:
Change graph year by clicking relevant year tab in Header sectionView totals/subtotals by hovering over graph lines/columns:Change graph interval (month/quarter)by clicking the interval buttons:Select/unselect graph category by clicking a category element:
Totals/subtotal data is affected by month/quarter display.Equity and Variables are excluded from the Totals calculation
Breakdown Section
Section Structure
 
#ComponentData/Function1PeriodSelect period for cost breakdown2Pay CycleSelect pay cycle for cost breakdown. This component is enabled only when selected period is Pay Cycle.3CostItemized cost breakdown, by category, using actual + expected data for selected period4DistributionDistribution (by %) of cost categories, using actual + expected data for selected period
Changing Data Display
You can manage graph data display:
Change data display period by clicking the period buttons:View itemized cost breakdown by clicking a catrgory tile:View cost distribution subtotals via donut sections:

title: Worker Sync Update Cycle
body:
What is the Worker Sync Update Cycle?
Papaya’s Worker Sync file update cycle interface allows you to sync employee HRIS information, such as new hires, job titles, personal information – as well as workers’ contractual information such as compensations that shall be further used in the payroll process. 
 
Typically, an update will take place prior to initiation of a payroll cycle. It can also be used to bulk update data types that aren't necessarily in your HRIS system for Payroll and employee workers (bulk upload does not support EOR workers).
This process allows syncing various numbers of workers, both as part of the onboarding process and periodically as part of the preparation for the payroll cycle process. This includes syncing joiners and leavers, as well as updating existing workers’ info and compensation.
Worker Sync Excel Template
Note: the file and its attendant processes are relevant for SFTP and file import update processes. API sync is fully automatic and does not require any file exchange.
The Excel template includes different types of worker information involved in the payroll process. The file may include all your Papaya employees, or only the relevant employees that have undergone changes in their details. 
Click here to download the Worker Sync Excel template.
The key identifier for each employee record is the Papaya Project ID, which is assigned by Papaya per payroll unit. You may have multiple projects for Papaya workers in your organization.
Note: each file may contain up to 2000 employee records.
Worker Sync Fields
The template has a Guidelines tab that provides some of the information detailed below. Mandatory fields are indicated by a red *
 
The worker sync file contains the following fields:
 
Support for Multiple Projects
To support multiple projects, the following options are available:
Using 1 file per Papaya project with 1 project ID in each file (recommended)Using 1 file for all projects, requiring you to map new employees to Papaya’s project ID.
Worker Sync Information Update Options
The following options are supported for Worker Sync file updates:
SFTP file update - click here  for more information.Integration Center (API) updates - click here  for more information.Via file upload - contact your CSM for more information.

title: How do I reset my password?
body:
If you have forgotten your password or your password has expired and you need to reset it, please follow these steps:
1. Go to your Papaya Global company login URL.  If you don’t have your login link see this article: 
What is my company's login link to Papaya Platform?
 
2. Click "Forgot your Password?" on the login page
 
3. Type in your email address and click "Send Email" 
This will generate a "Forgot your Password?" email.
 
4.  Follow the instructions in the email to reset your password.
 
5. Set & Confirm a new password for your account and login to the platform
 
If you still have trouble logging in, please contact Technical Support

title: How secure is my data on Papaya?
body: Protecting your personal data is Papaya's number one priority. We treat all of your data with the same care and diligence as we do our own data. We invest time actively monitoring traffic patterns and interactions for specific security threats. Our robust monitoring system and effective network and data security policies in place allows us to provide end-to-end security and privacy in accordance with most advanced security best practices. You can read more in details in our privacy policy

title: I can't log in to my account, what should I do?
body:
If you are already signed up to the Papaya Platform, you need to use the same email address to log in.
 
Follow these steps to be sure you are using the correct email address and login link:
 
1. Check your email for a message from papayaglobal.com to ensure you are using the correct email address to log in. 
 
If you don't find an email from Papaya, check your other email accounts such as your personal email accounts. 
 
2. To find your company's login link (URL), go to https://papayaglobal.com/find-login/For further instructions review the following article.What is my company's login link to Papaya Platform?
 
If you are still experiencing issues please contact Technical Support

title: SFTP connection - Security Overview
body:
Papaya Global’s SFTP connection - Security Overview
 
Papaya offers a secure solution for uploading and managing various file types through a dedicated Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server. This document highlights the key security measures employed by Papaya to safeguard the solution. 
 
Encryption in Transit: 
Encryption in transit is employed during the file transit. All files uploaded through the Papaya SFTP server are encrypted in transit using a secure SSH connection.  
 
Authentication: 
The authentication to the server is performed using a customer-generated public key. This secure authentication process validates the identity and access rights of users connecting to the server.  
 
Multi-tenancy: 
Papaya is utilizing multi-tenancy architecture to ensure that each customer's data and resources remain isolated and separated.  
 
IP Whitelisting: 
Papaya enforces customer IP whitelisting. Only specific customer IP addresses or predefined IP ranges are authorized to access the server. This restriction minimizes the risk of unauthorized access attempts from unknown or malicious sources. 
 
Access Control: 
Papaya employs stringent access control measures based on the principle of least privilege. Access permissions are granted to users based on their job roles and responsibilities. 
 
Vulnerability Scanning: 
To identify and address potential vulnerabilities in the system, Papaya performs ongoing vulnerability scans. These scans involve different security tools that examine the system infrastructure, software components, configurations and other security-related findings.The identified vulnerabilities are being assessed and mitigated according to the Papaya processes.

title: What information should I add when opening a Papaya Support ticket?
body:
When you're troubleshooting an issue with the Papaya portal, and you need to contact Papaya support, you may want to first capture some additional information so that we could better help you. 
For example, it can be helpful to share browser traces, step recordings, and console output. This information can provide important details about what exactly is happening in the portal when your issue occurs. 
Warning: Browser traces often contain sensitive information and might include authentication tokens linked to your identity. Please remove any sensitive information before sharing traces with others. Papaya support uses these traces for troubleshooting purposes only. 
 
You can capture this information in any supported browser, choose your browser to view the steps to get the additional information, 
Microsoft Edge 
Google Chrome 
Safari (on Mac) 
Edge
 
 
Microsoft Edge 
The following steps show how to use the developer tools in Microsoft Edge. For more information, see Microsoft Edge DevTools. 
 Note 
The screenshots below show the DevTools in Focus Mode with a vertical Activity Bar. Depending on your settings, your configuration may look different. For more information, see Simplify DevTools using Focus Mode. 
Sign in to the Papaya portal. It's important to sign in before you start the trace so that the trace doesn't contain sensitive information related to your account. 
Press F12 to launch Microsoft Edge DevTools. You can also launch the tools from the toolbar menu under More tools > Developer tools.
By default, the browser keeps trace information only for the page that's currently loaded. Set the following options so the browser keeps all trace information, even if your repro steps require going to more than one page
Select the Console tab, select Console settings, then select Preserve Log. 
Select the Network tab. If that tab isn't visible, click the More tools (+) button and select Network. Then, from the Network tab, select Preserve log. 
On the Network tab, select Stop recording network log and Clear.   
Select Record network log, then reproduce the issue in the portal.  
A session output similar to the following image will appear.
 After you have reproduced the unexpected portal behavior, select Stop recording network log, then select Export HAR and save the file.   
Back in the browser developer tools pane, select the Console tab. Right-click one of the messages, then select Save as..., and save the console output to a text file.  
Package the browser trace HAR file, console output, in a compressed format such as .zip and Share the compressed file with Papaya support. 
Chrome
 
 
Google Chrome  
The following steps show how to use the developer tools in Google Chrome. For more information, see Chrome DevTools. 
  Sign in to the Papaya portal It's important to sign in before you start the trace so that the trace doesn't contain sensitive information related to your account.  
Press F12 to launch the developer tools. You can also launch the tools from the toolbar menu under More tools > Developer tools.  
By default, the browser keeps trace information only for the page that's currently loaded. Set the following options so the browser keeps all trace information, even if your repro steps require going to more than one page
Select the Console tab, select Console settings, then select Preserve Log.  
Select the Network tab, then select Preserve log. 
On the Network tab, select Stop recording network log and Clear.  
Select Record network log, then reproduce the issue in the portal.  
A session output similar to the following image will appear.
After you have reproduced the unexpected portal behavior, select Stop recording network log, then select Export HAR and save the file.  
Stop the Steps Recorder and save the recording.  
Back in the browser developer tools pane, select the Console tab. Right-click one of the messages, then select Save as..., and save the console output to a text file. 
Package the browser trace HAR file, console output, in a compressed format such as .zip and Share the compressed file with Papaya support. 
Safari
 
 
Safari
The following steps show how to use the developer tools in Apple Safari on Mac. For more information, see Safari Developer Tools overview. 
Enable the developer tools in Safari:  
Select Safari, then select Preferences.  Select the Advanced tab, then select Show Develop menu in menu bar. 
Sign in to the Papaya portal, It's important to sign in before you start the trace so that the trace doesn't contain sensitive information related to your account.  
Select Develop, then select Show Web Inspector.  
By default, the browser keeps trace information only for the page that's currently loaded. Set the following options so the browser keeps all trace information, even if your repro steps require going to more than one page:  
Select the Console tab, then select Preserve Log.  
Select the Network tab, then select Preserve Log.  
On the Network tab, select Clear Network Items.  
Reproduce the issue in the portal. A session output similar to the following image will appear.
Back in the browser developer tools pane, select the Console tab, and expand the window. Place your cursor at the start of the console output then drag and select the entire contents of the output. Use Command-C to copy the output and save it to a text file.  
Package the browser trace HAR file, console output, in a compressed format such as .zip. and share the compressed file with Papaya Support.

title: What is my company's login link to Papaya Platform?
body:
When you register to Papaya's platform for the first time, we create a URL especially for your company. This way, we ensure security and confidentiality, which are top priorities for us. 
 
Through this unique URL, your company's users can access the Papaya Platform. Your URL will look like this: 
 
https://[your company name].papayaglobal.com/backoffice
 
You will receive your company's URL in the email you receive after completing platform registration for the first time. You can also retrieve it through the find my organization login link page at any time.  We recommend you bookmark the URL for easy access to Papaya. 
 
To find your company's login URL:
 
1. Browse to the URL below
https://papayaglobal.com/find-login/
 
2. Enter your user's email address and click CONFIRM.
 
 
This will generate an email with your company's login domain (URL).
 
 
If you do not get an email please contact your Papaya account manager.

title: What is Overwolf: Overwolf Support
body: Overwolf is a platform that allows gamers to create and use in-game apps. These apps can provide a variety of features, such as live game stats, video recording, and mod management.Overwolf is free to use, but some apps may require a subscription fee.Take me to...What are Overwolf apps?What kind of apps are there?What can these apps do for me?Is it safe?How much does it cost?So how do you make money?Will your apps slow my computer down?Which games do you support?Can I develop my own App?What are Overwolf apps?An Overwolf app is a program designed to enhance the gaming experience by providing additional features and functionality in one or more games. These apps can include things like in-game overlays, recording and sharing functions, voice communication tools, and game-specific tools and statistics. Apps can be downloaded and installed through the Overwolf Appstore.Once you have installed Overwolf and the apps you want to use, starting the game will start the apps as well. Overwolf Settings allows you to control which apps launch automatically (right-click the Overwolf tray icon and choose Settings).Using the relevant hotkey, you can show or hide any running apps, and use them at your leisure. Hotkeys can be configured in the settings window.What kind of apps are there?There are various types of apps available on the Overwolf app store, which can be broadly categorized into the following categories:Game-Specific OverlayThese apps provide in-game overlays and tools that are tailored to a specific game. For example, an overlay that shows your team's location in a first-person shooter game or an app that provides real-time statistics and information about your character in a massively multiplayer online role-playing game.Game Recording and Video SharingThere are apps that allow you to record and share your gameplay, such as Outplayed for example.Game UtilitiesThese apps provide useful tools and information to help players improve their gameplay. For example, an app that displays your ping and fps or one that helps you track your progress and achievements in a game.Game statistics trackingThese apps allow you to track your statistics and performance in games, like showing you your win rate, damage dealt and received, and more.These are just some examples of the types of apps available on the Overwolf app store, and new apps are being developed all the time.What can these apps do for me?With all of these functionality options, apps can enhance your gameplay in various ways, from giving you an edge in esports, a helping hand in an MMO, or helping you capture and share some sick plays with your friends and followers online.And, of course, if you have some basic coding knowledge and a solid idea, Overwolf apps can be your ticket to a new profitable career as an in-game creator.Is it safe?YESApps on the overwolf platform comply with all safety and privacy laws and regulations. Before an app is uploaded to the app store, we make sure that it is functioning properly, safe to use and does not contain any inappropriate content.How much does it cost?Apps on the Overwolf Appstore are free (although some offer a subscription premium account as well) and meant to be enjoyed by everyone. So how do you make money?Within every app, a small section at the bottom of the screen is dedicated to monetizing the app, giving the developer a chance to earn an income by allowing ads in that section. While most of the revenue goes to the developers, Overwolf keeps a small percentage, and that is how we generate revenue. It is important to note that Overwolf does not sell any user data! The privacy of our players is of utmost concern to us, and we make sure it is very well protected. Will your apps slow my computer down?Overwolf apps are designed never to harm FPS, ping, or cause any performance issues. By providing developers with the lightest and most efficient ways to create an overlay and receive telemetry, we can make sure the games themselves are not compromised in any way, while the developers can focus on creating the best possible apps. Which games do you support?We support hundreds of games, and are constantly working to add more top games to the list. Check out our supported games list to learn more.Can I develop my own App?You bet! Visit https://overwolf.github.io/, download the SDK, and get coding! Our funding and support services may be able to assist you if your concept is solid, but you need assistance translating it into an app, or if the project is too big to tackle by yourself.Once your app is ready, let us know, and we'll publish it in the Appstore so the rest of the world can enjoy your creation!

title: How to export your Overwolf logs: Overwolf Support
body: Windows OSRight-click your Overwolf tray icon and hit 'Support'Click on 'Create logs zip'The location window will pop automatically, with the zip highlighted - send it to us :)Overwolf failed during installation? Don't see the option to 'Create logs zip'? No problem.Here you will find the step-by-step manual guide to get them logs!Windows 10 / 11Close the Overwolf clientPress Windows key + R OR use the “Find” buttonType in: %localappdata%Press "Enter"Enter a folder named “Overwolf”Inside the Overwolf folder there is the "Log" folderUsing a program like 7-Zip, Winzip or Winrar (they all have free versions), create a .rar (or .zip) file of the "Log" folderAttach the file you just created to your support e-mail/formManual guide video:macOSOpen your Mac FinderGo to:Local user > Library > Application support > CurseForge > Agent > Logs > CurseClientAndLocal user > Library > Application support > CurseForgeSend us these folders (you can compress them to a ZIP file if they are too big)Please add the following file as well: Library > Logs > CurseForge > main.logCan't locate the folders? They may be hidden, so please follow these steps first:In the Finder's side menu, click the icon that looks like a house icon (if you can't see it, please enable it first through the Finder's preferences)Open the display function with the key combination “Command” + “J”Select the option “Show Library Folder” Click on "Use as default" so that the folders remain permanently visible

title: How to Manage Your Overwolf Hotkeys: Overwolf Support
body: This article will show you how to activate and manage your apps' assigned hotkeys for in-game control with Overwolf.In order to avoid conflicting with different games' hotkeys, we are now introducing a new way to manage Overwolf apps hotkeys - all of the hotkeys of an app are managed per game. So for example, you can set the Browser app's hotkey to Ctrl+B in CS:GO, and set it to Ctrl+A in Apex Legends.In addition, you can assign a certain hotkey in different games, and it will control a different app in each of them.*The default hotkey for Overwolf's dock is Ctrl + Tab.To assign / unassign hotkeys follow these steps:Go to your Overwolf settings (wrench icon on your Overwolf dock, or right click the Overwolf tray icon and choose "Settings")Navigate to the "Overlay & Hotkeys" tab on the left menuChoose a game from the list that you wish to edit they hotkeys for Click on the existing hotkey combination for a specific app for that game, and press the combination of your choiceIf you wish to unassign a hotkey, just hover over it and click on the "X" button when it appearsYou may also choose to assign a specific hotkey to all the game (only for global apps, which support more than one game, like the Browser), just hover over it and click on the arrow icon when it appears.

title: What is my Overwolf version and how to update it: Overwolf Support
body: Overwolf is a dynamic platform, we keep updating it every few weeks to keep up with our community's feedback, fix bugs and add new features. It's highly important to keep Overwolf updated at all times to ensure that your gaming experience remains awesome!Take me to...How do I find out my Overwolf version?How do I update my Overwolf version? / How can I tell if my version is the latest available?Help I can't update Overwolf!How do I find out my Overwolf version?Right-click your Overwolf tray icon and go to 'Settings'Go to 'About'See the number stated next to 'Client version'. This is it!How do I update my Overwolf version? / How can I tell if my version is the latest available?Right-click your Overwolf tray icon and go to 'Settings'Go to 'About'Click on 'Check for Updates' - there are 3 possible outcomes:You will get a message saying you already got the newest version - all good!You have an update ready and installed, but need to re-launch Overwolf for the update to kick in - do it!An update will start running right away and once it's done, you will be prompted to re-launch Overwolf - go for it!To check if you are running the latest version of Overwolf check out our Release Notes Here.Help I can't update Overwolf!Is the update stuck? Got any kind of error?Please try to update Overwolf manually by following these steps:Open the following folder: C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Overwolf\ or C:\Program Files (x86)\OverwolfRight-click the file 'OverwolfUpdater.exe' and select 'Run as administrator'Accept the UAC permission requestIt may appear as if nothing is happening, but you should wait a few secondsRestart OverwolfYou should now have the latest Overwolf version installed!

title: How to Show Overwolf In-Game / While Streaming: Overwolf Support
body: If you stream your gameplay with OBS Studio, Streamlabs or OBS.Live (by StreamElements), use the 'Game Capture' mode, and w to display Overwolf overlay in your stream - please follow these steps:Open OBS Studio/Streamlabs/OBS.LiveOpen the settings window for the "Source" that captures the game client (right click on the source and select "Properties")At the bottom of the properties window, check the option "Capture third-party overlays"Save the changesOverwolf should now be displayed correctly in your stream.

title: How to Create an Overwolf Account?: Overwolf Support
body: In case you still haven't claimed your nickname in Overwolf, let us show you how:Go to Overwolf.com and download Overwolf, or visit the Overwolf Appstore to download a specific app that you'd like (it will download Overwolf as well)Install Overwolf on your PCRight-click Overwolf's taskbar icon and open the Overwolf AppstoreClick the 'Login' button:You can sign up using any of the social accounts listed (Google, Facebook, Discord, Twitch), or you can create a new account by entering your email address and setting up a passwordIf you sign up with an email and a password, you'll be required to complete the Captcha test (robots are not allowed!)You're all set and good to go!Wish to change your account's email address?Please send us a ticket with the following details:Overwolf user name / Date of the account's creationCurrent email addressNew email addressWe will update the information and let you know as soon as it's done :)Kick-Ass! Now you have your own Overwolf account, hope to see you in-game soon!Looking to delete your Overwolf account? These instructions are in another castle! Click here for instructions on Deleting Your Overwolf Account and Related Data

title: Scaling Overwolf Apps to Appear Properly with a High DPI Setting: Overwolf Support
body: If the DPI setting recommended by your system is over 100% (mostly for 4K monitors), please follow the next steps to ensure that the overlay is displayed properly within your game:Open up your Overwolf installation folder (C:\Program Files (x86)\Overwolf by default)Right-click on the file called Overwolf.exeChoose "Properties"Go to the "Compatibility" tabClick on "Change high DPI settings"Check the box for "Override high scaling behavior"For "Scaling performed by" choose "System (Enhanced)"Re-launch Overwolf to make sure that the changes are appliedAnother option is to scale down the DPI to 100% (if your native monitor resolution is lower than 4K). In order to do that, please follow the next steps:Windows 11Press the Windows key + RType in: DpiScaling.exeSelect 100% from the dropdown list:Sign out and back in to your Windows account (if you skip this step, the changes won't have any effect)Windows 10Press the Windows key + RType in: DpiScaling.exeDrag the bar pointer to 100%Click "Apply"Sign out and back in to your Windows account (if you skip this step, the changes won't have any effect) This will lower your DPI to 100% and will fix any issue triggered by DPI enlargement.

title: How to Re-Install Overwolf with a Clean Slate: Overwolf Support
body: For users who cannot overcome their issues or encounter multiple problems, we recommend to proceed with the following steps to give Overwolf a chance for a clean start.Let's do a clean sweep and re-install it:Press 'Start'Click on 'Control Panel'Look for 'Programs and Features'Find 'Overwolf' and remove/uninstall it.Once you finish the uninstall process, head to C:\Program Files (x86) and check if you have an Overwolf folder (you shouldn't), delete it if you do. Then proceed to do the following:Press Windows key + RIn the bar type %localappdata%Press 'Enter'Find and delete the Overwolf folderOnce you do that, please download Overwolf with your preferred app here, then launch Overwolf.

title: Overwolf Not Launching / Crashing On Launch: Overwolf Support
body: Try the new Overwolf Troubleshooter now!	Windows OS Updates ▾Overwolf may not launch properly or even crash when Windows is outdated. We highly recommend making sure that all Windows system updates are installed, as they are necessary for the proper operation of different components (.NET Framework, for instance). To check if there are updates available for your system, please click here.If you have any system updates pending, please install them, restart your system and then try to launch Overwolf again.In case you're still unable to launch Overwolf, please try the following solutions:Take me to..."Failed to start application"System File CheckerAntivirus Software.NET Frameworkmachine.config file"Could not find essential Overwolf files..."Overwolf Setup Installer"Failed to start application" ▾Please uninstall Overwolf from your system and reinstall it to the default directory, C:\Program Files (x86)\Overwolf\.This issue can also be caused due to a missing Windows component - Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable (read more about it here).Download this component here, install it, restart your system and try to launch Overwolf again.If these solution did not help, please try the System File Checker.System File Checker ▾Running a system file check can fix faulty system files that are required for Overwolf to run properly.It's easy to run such a check - just follow these steps:Run CMD as administratorPaste the following command into the CMD and press 'Enter' to run it: sfc /scannowThe process can a bit of time, that's normal :)Once the process is finished check if the issue is fixed.If it isn't, try to run it again with 3 additional commands, in the following sequence:sfc /scannowDism /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealthDism /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealthDism /Online /Cleanup-Image /restoreHealthsfc /scannow If that doesn't fix the issue either, please open this folder: C:\Windows\Logs\CBS and send us the file called CBS.log as well as your Overwolf logs for inspection, so we can provide further assistance.Antivirus Software ▾Stuck on "Preparing for first launch..."In certain cases, Overwolf's first launch (after installation) comes across an issue and cannot continue.We have found this can happen due to an antivirus software called 'SAntivirus' (or Segurazu Antivirus) and that disabling it can solve the issue. For more information, please click here.Even though Overwolf is 100% safe to use and is very popular among gamers all over the world, some antivirus programs have blacklisted it in the past, and using them might prevent Overwolf from launching properly on your PC.If upon launching Overwolf, nothing happens (the Appstore won't open, you can't see the dock, etc.), please follow the next steps:Click on the Windows key + RType: "regedit" and click "Yes"In the file explorer to your left, start opening folders by this path:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE -> SOFTWARE -> Microsoft -> Windows NT -> CurrentVersion -> Image File Execution OptionsOn the file explorer to your left, look for folders named 'overwolf.exe' and 'overwolflauncher.exe'If they exist, right-click them and choose "Delete"Try running Overwolf.NET Framework ▾Overwolf is based on .NET Framework 4.8 and later .NET versions.It's possible that .NET 4.8 wasn't installed properly on your PC, in which case Overwolf won't be able to run due to some corrupted files.This might occur due to a Windows update gone wrong or due to outdated drivers.The best solution is reinstalling your current .NET Framework 4.8 version:Press the Windows key + RType in: appwiz.cplClick on "Turn Windows features on or off"Look for the ".NET Framework 4.8" and uncheck the box next to itClick "OK" and waitOnce it is done close it and restart your computerFollow steps 1-4 in order to re-check the ".NET Framework 4.8" optionRestart your computerTry running Overwolfmachine.config file ▾Certain corruptions in .NET Framework's machine.config files may prevent Overwolf from running.To fix these corruptions, please follow these steps:Open the folder C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\Config\Locate the file called 'machine.config'Delete the fileLocate the file 'machine.config.default'Create a copy of it (just as back up)Rename the original 'machine.config.default' file to 'machine.config'Repeat steps 2-4 for the folder C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\Config\Re-launch Overwolf"Could not find essential Overwolf files..." ▾If you received this error, please try the following solutions:Open the following directory ﻿C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Overwolf\0.xxx.x.xx (version number) and check if it contains the following files: OverwolfHelper.exe and OverwolfHelper64.exeIf these files are missing, please reinstall Overwolf using this installer.Open the following directory ﻿C:\Program Files (x86)\Overwolf, check that it contains the file Overwolf.exe and that the file is not set to run as an administrator.If the file is missing, please make sure that it's not getting deleted/quarantined by an anti-virus software, then reinstall Overwolf using this installer.Overwolf Setup Installer ▾If the above-mentioned solutions did not help you overcome the issue, please try to run the setup installer. It comes in a zipped file, so you will first need to extract it by using any program like WinZip, WinRAR or 7-Zip.Issue not resolved? Try running the Overwolf Troubleshooter!If it doesn't resolve the issue please click on Create Logs Zip and then Contact Support to open a support ticket with your log files so we can further investigate the matter.

title: Overwolf Installation Troubleshooting: Overwolf Support
body: Try the new Overwolf Troubleshooter now!	Take me to...Installer showing the error "We have encountered a problem during the installation..."Installation stuck on "Extracting Files"Installer displayed incorrectlyInstaller showing a "Connection Error"Installer not starting / finishing properlyOverwolf setup installerClean reinstall Overwolf clientInstallation file is getting removedRivaTuner conflictInstaller showing the error "We have encountered a problem during the installation..." ▾The installer may come across an issue while downloading or installing certain files. To fix this issue, please install the latest available updates for your Windows OS. To check for available updates for your system, please click here.If you're still experiencing the same issue after updating your system, please try to run the setup installer instead.Installation stuck on "Extracting Files" ▾If Overwolf's installer keeps getting stuck on "Extracting Files" please try to run the setup installer instead.Installer displayed incorrectly ▾In certain cases the installer may appear 'broken' and it will be displayed incorrectly. If that happens, please contact us.Installer showing a "Connection Error" ▾This issue is commonly caused by the following:An
