title: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Dashboard
body:
Overview
Previously: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
Please review the Generic Tools and Smart Tables guides before proceeding.
The DE&I dashboard provides an analysis of diversity, equity, and inclusion data: breaking down workers by gender and age, providing pay ration calculations, etc.
 
 
The DE&I dashboard has the following sections:
#DetailsExample Breakdown1Filters - choose parameters (period, service, etc.) for filtering report data.DE&I data for Payroll workers, in All cost centers and All projects2Data reflects workers with "gender"parameter in the Papaya platform.						Drill down for a more detailed analysis.For payroll workers in all projects & cost centers:			Q3 2021 - 56% male workers, 48% female workers.						Q4 2021 - 57% male workers, 43% female workers.						...etc.3
			Pay Equity by Gender - male-to-female salary ratio, in percentage.
			 
			The displayed % is that of the male salary to female salary, by country.
			 
			Drill down for a more detailed analysis.
			
			For payroll workers in all projects & cost centers:
			 
			In all countries - male salary is 83% of female salary.
			 
			In Mexico -male salary is 127% of female salary.
			 
			In China - male salary is 97% of female salary.
			 
			...etc.
			4
			Pay Ratio - ratio of highest-to-lowest salary, by country.
			 
			Drill down for a more detailed analysis.
			
			For payroll workers in all projects & cost centers:
						In all countries - highest salary is  34.1 times higher than lowest salary..
			 
			In Mexico -highest salary is 53 times higher than lowest salary.
			 
			In China - highest salary is 10.6 times higher than lowest salary.
			 
			...etc.
			5
			Median Age - age distribution of workers.
			 
			Drill down for a more detailed analysis.
			
			For payroll workers in all projects & cost centers:
						Age 26 and under - 9% of workers
			 
			Age 26-30 - 13% of workers
			 
			...etc.
			6DEI Metrics Analysis - analysis of DE&I metrics by Cost Center.
			This section repeats the data breakdown of sections 1-6 by Cost Center, in individual tabs.
			 
			See tab drill-down for more details.
			7DEI Report Configuration - generates a DEI report
			Configuration and formatting of a PDF DEI report for downloading, printing, and disseminating.
			 
			See report options for more details.
			
 
The dashboard has a number of auxiliary data fields.
Using the DE&I Dashboard
Select filter parametersDrill down by sectionSave view
Select Filter Parameters
In the top toolbar, select filter parameters:
 
Service - the type of worker by which you want to filter data (Payroll, EOR, etc.). Once you select the Service type, the dashboard will automatically udpate.
 
Project - the project by which you want to filter data. You can select one or more projects, or All projects. Click Apply to update the dashboard. 
 
Cost Center - the cost center by which you want to filter data. You can select one or more cost centers, or All cost centers. Click Apply to update the dashboard.
Drill Down by Section
Gender Equality Drill Down
Hover over the section summary to view the number of workers not included in the analysis due to undefined "gender"parameter:
 
 
Hover over a time period component and use the -/+ buttons to drill up/down the time scale:
 
Pay Equity by Gender Drill Down
Hover over the section summary to view data source period, and the worker count included in the calculation:
 
 
Hover over a country bar section to view worker count and period details:
 
Pay Ratio Drill Down
Hover over the section summary to view data source period, and the worker count included in the calculation:
 
Hover over a country bar to view pay ratio details:
Median Age Drill Down
Hover over the section summary to view the number of workers not included in the analysis due to missing "seniority start" parameter:
 
Hover over an age bar to view worker count:
DE&I Metrics Drill Down
The DE&I Metrics section has 4 tabs:
 
 
#TabDrill-Down1
			Gender Equality by Cost Center- breakdown of male/female workers by cost center.
			 
			Gender Equity by Country - breakdown of male/female workers by cost center.
			
			Hover over a bar section to view worker count.
			 
			Click on a bar section to filter all dashbaord data by cost center/country.
			2Pay Equity by Gender - ratio of male to female pay, in %.
			Hover over a cost center bar to view worker count and period.
			 
			Click to open a drill-down dialog .
			3Pay Ratio - ratio of highest-to-lowest ssalary, by cost center.
			Hover over a cost center bar to view worker count and period.
						Click to open a drill-down dialog .
			4Median Age - age distribution of workers, by cost center.
			Hover over a cost center bar to view worker count and period.
						Click to open a drill-down dialog .
			
Save View
Save specific views (i.e. dashboards with applied filters) for easy access, so you will not have to apply the same filters every time you open the dashboard.
Generate DEI Report
Click to download a DE&I Report brochure
After filtering the data in the DEI Dashboard, you can generate a formatted report, and select the information to be included in the output.
 
To generate & download a DEI report:
 
Click the Generate DEI Report button. The dashboard will switch to a report view, without all filter and tab options:			 Click the Download button at the top right corner of the screen, select PDF and click Download. You cannot download this report in Excel format:			 A download dialog will open, ofering you the following options:		Include - which information to include in the report. We recommend selecting This View, and utilizing dashboard filters to select report information.	Scaling - scaling of report elements in the generated PDF.	Page Size - page size in generated PDF (Letter, A4, etc.)	Orientation - page orientation in generated PDF (Portrait/Landscape). We rcommend selecting Landscape for better data layout.Click Download. The PDF report will download, according to your selections and configuraion:

title: HR Analytics Dashboard
body:
Dashboard Overview
Previously: HR Analytics, Joiners & Leavers, HR Events
Please review the Generic Tools and Smart Tables guides before proceeding.
The HR Analytics Dashboard allows you to view and analyze HR data using a variety of organizational parameters.
 
The HR Analytics dashbaord has 5 tabs:
HR AnalyticsWorker ContractsJoiners/LeaversHR MilestonesMissing Data
HR Analytics Tab
Tab Overview
The HR Analytics tab provides a high-level overview of worker status:
 
 
The HR Analytics tab has the following sections:
#DetailsExample Breakdown1Tab Selection - select the tab you wish to view and use.The selected tab is HR Analytics.2Filters - choose parameters (period, service, etc.) for filtering tab data.Worker data for April 2022, for All employee types, for All projects and All cost centers.3
			Active Workers- number of active workers, with comparison to previous month.
			 
			Note that active workers includes workers who are active at least 1 day in the selected month.
			
			There are 218 active workers in April 2022, for All employee types, for All projects and All cost centers.
			 
			This is an increase of 6 workers (3%) from the previous month (i.e. there were 212 workers in March 2022)
			4
			Joiners/Leavers - number of workers who have joined/left, with prediction for coming months.
			 
			Note that both Leavers and Joiners data is based on contract dates.
			
			Joiners - 10 workers joined in April 22 and 6 more are expected to join in May 2022.
			 
			Leavers- 7 workers have contracts that end in April 22 and 6 more are expected to leave (i.e. contract ends) in May 2022.
			5Worker Anniverseries/Birthdays - workers with birthdays or work anniverseries in the selected month.
			24 workers have work anniverseries in April 2022.
			 
			23 workers have birthdays in April 2022.
			6
			Active Workers by Country & Project - breakd down placement of active workers by country & project. 
			 
			Drill down to view and additional information.
			
			Pragma, China project has 99 active workers in April 2022.
			 
			Pragma, China project has 48 active workers in April 2022.
						...etc.
			7
			Active Workers by Cost Center - placement of active workers by cost center.
			 
			Drill down to view additional information.
			
			Operations cost center has 62 active workers in April 2022.
			 
			Engineering cost center has 57 active workers in April 2022.
			 
			...etc.
			8
			Active Workers by Service over Time - worker count and type over selected period (default: 6 months).
			 
			Drill down to view additional information.
			
			November 2021 had 194 active workers of all types
			 
			December 2021 had 204 active workers of all types.
			 
			...etc.
			9
			Active Workers Change- change in worker count in selected months.
			 
			Drill down to view additional information.
			
			January 2022 had 194 active workers of all types
			 
			April 2022 had 208 active workers of all types
						21 workers joined and 7 workers left between January and April 2022.
			
 
The tab has a number of auxiliary data fields.
Using the HR Analytics Tab

The Payments dashboard has the following sections:
#DetailsExample Breakdown1Filters - choose parameters for filtering dashboard data.Payments made by Papaya for the Pragma Germany project, in the pay period of November 2021, with a transaction date between 1st October 2021 and 30th December 20212Payments Amount - total amount of payments made by Papaya per filter parameters.Total amount of payments made by Papaya for the Pragma Germany project, in the pay period of November 2021, with a transaction date between 1st October 2021 and 30th December 2021 is US$50,702.3Worker Payments- total count of worker payments made by Papaya per filter parameters.Papaya made 8 worker payments for the Pragma Germany project, in the pay period of November 2021, with a transaction date between 1st October 2021 and 30th December 2021.43rd Party Payments - total count of 3rd party payments made by Papaya per filter parameters.Papaya made 0 3rd party payments for the Pragma Germany project, in the pay period of November 2021, with a transaction date between 1st October 2021 and 30th December 2021.5ICP Payments - total count of ICP payments made by Papaya per filter parameters.Papaya made 0 ICP payments for the Pragma Germany project, in the pay period of November 2021, with a transaction date between 1st October 2021 and 30th December 2021.6Payments Breakdown - detailed list of payments corresponding to filter parameters.

Select filter parametersModify smart tableSave view

title: Report: How to create and save a favorite BI View (HR & Finance Teams)
body: One question we frequently receive is: “How can a user save a favorite view, after all filters selections are made, so the user can easily come back to those selections next time?” Good news! This capability already exists in all BI dashboards through our platform, and any user can create and save as many pre-defined favorite views as needed for his dashboards.Of course, the views a user save, are only visible to that user. However, the Papaya BI team can provide you with the ability to save views that will apply to all users. Below is a short and simple guide How to create a favorite BI ViewSelect all of your filters (for example: show only projects with payroll service), click on “View: Original” button at the top toolbar.2.  In the form, name your favorite view and save it. If you want this view to always appear first as you log-in to that dashboard, check the “make it my default” box.Next time you log in to that report, and click the “View: Original” button, you can select your favorite view and automatically apply all your favorite selections.

title: Reports: Billing Reports
body: Papaya allows clients to analyze global workforce costs based on invoice data, and allows them to easily drill down to the period, project, worker and cost item level.Billing Overview DashboardA high level overview of employment costs, showing trends over time, high level costs, and a breakdown of worker costs, fees and all cost items.All invoice data are consolidated together in a one place.New Pivot table allows users to analyze their costs from invoice data, and allows them to easily drill down to the period, project, worker and cost item level.Billing Status DashboardIncludes charts to quickly understand invoice status (paid, unpaid, unpaid and overdue), as well as a summary table.Provides visibility of deposit vs standard invoices.Includes a summary table of all paid and unpaid invoices.Billing and EOR AnalysisUse this report if you want to have the invoice IDs as the leading entity.5 different views – from a summary table to the full breakdown of the invoices, consolidated into a single table.Ability to filter invoices status (paid, unpaid ) and invoice type (deposit, credit, standard).Billing Payroll Costs BreakdownIncludes everything from the Payroll Costs Breakdown report, but instead of Gross-to-Net data, it is based on invoice data. Great alternative for EOR customers who do not have Gross-to-Net Data.8 pre-defined views – Per Project, Per Period, Per Cost Center and Per Worker, summarized or expanded.Custom views and build-your-own-report capability using the filters.

title: Retention Analysis Dashboard
body:
Overview
Previously: Retention Metrics
Please review the Generic Tools and Smart Tables guides before proceeding.
The Retention Analysis dashboard provides an analysis of worker retention, with breakdown by reason for leaving, age, and etc.
 
 
The Retention Analysis dashboard has the following sections:
#DetailsExample Breakdown1Filters - choose parameters (period, service, etc.) for filtering report data.Retention data for Payroll workers, in All cost centers and All projects2
			Retention & Turnover  - worker retention and turnover over time (default view: 4 recent quarters).
			 
			Data reflects workers active from first day of analysis period to last day of analysis period (retention), and workers who left during analysis period (turnover).
			 
			Due to the data used, percentage of retention + turnover may not = 100%
			 
			Drill down for a more detailed analysis.
			
			For payroll workers in all projects & cost centers:
						Q3 2021 - 88% worker retention, 7% worker turnover.
			 
			Q4 2021 - 91% worker retention, 5% worker turnover.
						...etc.
			3
			Reasons for Leaving - worker reasons for leaving.
			 
			Data reflects workers who left over the past year, and who filled in the "reasons for leaving" parameter.
			 
			 
			Drill down for a more detailed analysis.
			
			For payroll workers in all projects & cost centers:
			 
			Resignation - 58% of workers who left within the past year (38 workers), left voluntarily.
			4
			Seniority - leavers seniority.
			 
			Data reflects workers who left over the past year, and who have a "seniority start" parameter.
			 
			 
			Drill down for a more detailed analysis.
			
			For payroll workers in all projects & cost centers:
						Seniority of 3 months or less - 14% of leavers in the past year.
			 
			Seniority between 3 months and 1 year - 14% of leavers in the past year.
						...etc.
			5Metrics by Cost Center & Country- analysis of retention metrics by Cost Center/Country.
			This section repeats the data breakdown of sections 1-4 by in individual tabs.
			 
			See tab drill-down for more details.
			
 
The dashboard has a number of auxiliary data fields.

title: Dashboard Tab (In-Country Partners)
body: The main dashboard provides a broad overview of every active, closed, and future solution, for each client separately. It shows the number of active people, types of service, and a link to our Countrypedia - Papaya's open-source guide to country's payroll and benchmarks.  You can switch the dashboard display from tiles to list by clicking on the icon in the right corner for a more focused view.  To drill down to any location, simply click on a solution to open the page and see all the information in one easy view.

title: Registration & Login to Papaya's Platform (In-Country Partners)
body:
We are excited to start working together! As we discussed, the Papaya's platform is the cornerstone of our partnership and where the entire process is managed. Once we set up your user identification and login on the platform, please complete this four-step registration within 48 hours (your unique link will expire after that).1. Invitation email - you will receive an auto email from the platform  Invitation to Join Papaya's Platform. If you can't find it, it may have gone to your spam folder (some email systems filter the first email from a new sender.) Look for emails from support@papayaglobal.com. Once found, please click on the link in the email to continue registration.Still cant find it? contact support@papayaglobal.com or your dedicated contact at Papaya for assistance. ﻿﻿2. Choose your password - once you click clicked on the link, you will be redirected to the web page (we recommend using the Google Chrome browser). Make sure your personal password is: 
At least 8 charactersContains at least one upper case letter (A-Z)Contains lower case letters (a-z)Contains a number (0-9)
Make sure your password matches when typing it in the second time and don't forget to review the terms and conditions and check the agree box!3. Your Data and Terms&Conditions consent  - review and approve our terms and conditions and the personal information required in order to maintain an active platform user identity. We only request the bare minimum from our stakeholders we need to create your Papaya platform identity. We put great care and effort in protecting your information, just as we would with our own information. For any questions regarding the privacy or security of personal data, don't hesitate to contact our legal team here.4. Confirmation email - All done! You will now receive your confirmation email Welcome to Papaya Global - Registration Successful. Don't forget to white list emails from us. We will be in touch ;).Remember to bookmark your access link to platform (also available here.)

title: Switching Between Organizations (In-Country Partners)
body: As our partnerships grow, we are able to add more solutions to our dashboard.  These new projects will be added to your permissions on our platform and can accessed simply by switching organizations on the top right arrow drop down.

title: Team Member Cost Plan Tab (In-Country Partners)
body: The Cost Plan tab inside of the Team Member Card allows our clients to view both current and yearly employment costs for each team member. We rely on your local expertise to build the employer costs simulation with as much detail and accuracy as possible. This tab shows annual gross costs for this project's people and a breakdown of the expected employer costs for Papaya clients in the designated country.   The tab allows you to see costs both in local currency or in your chosen billing currency (USD/EUR). Exchange rates are per the same day and might vary during the year. The amounts displayed are cost simulations only.

title: Top Navigation Bar (In-Country Partners)
body: The Top Navigation Bar is the main area for browsing the different functions of the platform. Dashboard -  contains all active, upcoming, new, and closed projects and their locations.Payroll - shows company payroll data - current and historical - divided by person reporting, salary updates, payroll summary, and payments.Files - presents a repository for pay-related documents, including PTO reports, commissions reports, team member onboarding packets, and much more.
